name: Pesto Chicken Zucchini Noodles
description: One Pot Pesto Chicken Zucchini Noodles are a delicious, simple dinner. Naturally gluten free, this meal comes together in under an hour!

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts (cut in ½ in cubes)
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts (cut in ½ in cubes)

recipe_ingredient.note: ¼ cup finely chopped fresh basil (finely chopped)
recipe_ingredient.display: ¼ cup finely chopped fresh basil (finely chopped)

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley (finely chopped)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley (finely chopped)

recipe_ingredient.note: ½ cup Trader Joe’s Kale Cashew Basil Pesto (or homemade pesto)
recipe_ingredient.display: ½ cup Trader Joe’s Kale Cashew Basil Pesto (or homemade pesto)

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 large zucchini (spiralized with water squeezed out - about 4 cups)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 large zucchini (spiralized with water squeezed out - about 4 cups)

recipe_instructions.text: In a large sauté pan or pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium high heat.
Add the chicken to the pan and let it cook for 10-12 minutes or until you get a nice golden brown color on the exterior. Make sure to stir occasionally to brown all sides.
While the chicken is cooking, halve tomatoes, spiralize zucchini and chop garlic and herbs.
Once the chicken is browned, remove from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic to the pan. You can spray the pan with olive oil if the garlic is sticking. Sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir in cherry tomatoes, basil, parsley, pepper and salt. Sauté for 5 minutes or until tomatoes are soft.
Once tomatoes are softened, stir in pesto and return the chicken to the pan.
Using tongs, gently toss in raw zucchini noodles, coating evenly in tomato/pesto mixture. Saute for an additional 1-2 minutes over medium heat until zucchini starts to soften.
Serve warm. You can top with Parmesan if you'd like!
